The town provides easy access to Heathrow and Gatwick airports, and a commuter train service facilitates access to Clapham Junction, London Waterloo and Reading. Inspired is prominently located on Easthampstead Road close to the town centre, which is currently being redeveloped. Located at the gateway to Upper Basing View, the 45,000 sq ft Grade A building has been designed to BREEAM Excellent and EPC A standards. A short walk from Basingstoke train station and the town’s main shopping facilities, Neon’s 57 cycle spaces, showers, drying and changing facilities make it easy for sustainable travel choices. The adjacent three-storey car park will be fitted with electric charging points and provide 130 car spaces, a ratio of 1:377 sq ft. Bracknell town centre is currently undergoing a comprehensive regeneration due for completion in the summer of 2017. This will provide a new retail heart to the town with retailers such as Fenwicks, H&M, Primark and M&S already signed up to take space alongside a new leisure offer to include Cineworld, Carluccio's, Jamie's Italian and Zizzi. Bracknell is ideally located to provide access to both the M3 and M4 corridors and the highly skilled workforces that reside within them. Bracknell's good transport links also allow fast access to the surrounding areas of stunning countryside. displayAddress: 1 Bell Street, Maidenhead, SL6 1BU
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Maidenhead Description The building boasts wide windows that let in plenty of natural light and has a staffed reception, offices, co-working, meeting rooms and admin support, with Maidenhead station just a short walk away. The business centre in Maidenhead Town Centre occupies three floors of a modern low-rise brick building, with wide windows letting in ample light. This compact town is close to the River Thames and is ideally situated for reaching clients and suppliers in London and the high-tech commercial hub of the Thames Valley. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, hot desks, meeting rooms, business grade Internet and a staffed reception. There is also admin support with mail handling and call answering included and a communal kitchen with tea and coffee making facilities. The building is within easy walking distance of this lively town's amenities, including hotels, Maidenhead railway station, bus stops and major A-roads leading to the strategic artery of the M4.

displayAddress: 377-399 London Road, Camberley, GU15 3HL
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Camberley Description The workspace is situated on the western edge of Camberley town centre and has offices, meeting rooms, breakout areas, staffed reception, 24/7 access, parking as well as easy access to the M3 and M25. The business centre provides office space with day-to-day support solutions from an experienced management team. The Camberley business centre is situated on the western edge of the town centre, giving easy access to the M3 and junction 12 of the M25. On offer are offices, meeting rooms, breakout areas and a staffed reception. There is also high-speed broadband, 24/7 access, parking and virtual office packages available.

displayAddress: Jubilee House, Globe Business Park, Marlow, SL7 1EY
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Marlow Description The workspace is located in a thriving area close to an attractive market town and offers private offices, flexible co-working space, meeting rooms and on-site parking, all close to the M40 and M4. Boasting a stylish interior and well-designed layout, the workspace provides a sought-after address in a thriving area that’s home to fifty-one national, global and independent firms. On offer is office space with 24/7 access as well as co-working space with designer desks, tables, sofas, super-fast Wi-Fi and informal meeting areas. There are also meeting rooms with A/V equipment, whiteboards and refreshments. There is on-site parking and it is situated close to the M40 and M4.

displayAddress: The Hub, Fowler Avenue, Farnborough, GU14 7JF
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Farnborough Description Once the departure lounge and control tower for Farnborough airport, this listed Art Deco building is now a part of the Farnborough Business Park and provides exceptional flexible office space in a very well-connected location. Providing 24-hour security, various dining options, generous parking, a nursery, the Village Hotel, and a free shuttle bus service running between the park, Farnborough town centre and the railway station – this business park has already been chosen by multinational companies, small and medium enterprises, and startup companies. The travel time from Farnborough train station to Central London is just over one hour. Farnborough airport services mainly private jets, and it is a 4-minute drive to the new terminal from the front door. Heathrow Airport is a 30-minute drive via the M3 motorway.

displayAddress: Quatro House, Lyon Way, Camberley, GU16 7ER
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Camberley Description This self-contained new building provides a modern airy reception, flooded with natural daylight and with a the ground floor business lounge which provides space for relaxed meetings. The edge of town location provides excellent transport links with the benefit of being close to local commerce and retail outlets. The High Street is just a five-minute walk away. Camberley is in the Surrey Heath area, 31 miles (50 km) southwest of central London, in the corridor between the M3 and M4 motorways. Surrey Heath's economy is buoyant and unemployment is low. Most of the area's industrial and commercial activity is concentrated around Camberley and Frimley, including some high-profile companies in software, pharmaceuticals, electronics, engineering and wealth management. Manufacturing still plays an important role although the trend is towards office-based services - particularly in the financial sector - and highly-skilled, often blue-chip, occupations

displayAddress: 1 Farnham Road, Guildford, GU2 4RG
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Guildford Description The building boasts an attractive top floor balcony and a clock tower and offers a staffed reception, offices, co-working, meeting rooms and admin support, all just moments from Guildford station. The Guildford business centre is located in an impressive new landmark development in the heart of historic Guildford. This stylish three-storey brick building has a unique design with an attractive top floor balcony and a clock tower. As well as being within easy commuting distance of London, Guildford is a well-to-do area with a vibrant economy. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, meeting rooms, business grade Internet, a staffed reception as well as admin support and the building is ideally located next to Guildford railway station.

displayAddress: Austen House, Station View, Units A-J, Guildford, GU1 4AD
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Guildford Description Located right by Guildford station, this contemporary business centre on the ground and first floor offers productive workspace in a tech savvy environment with superb transport links. As well as being home to Surrey Research Park, a centre of excellence in UK science and technology, Guildford also has a great university, providing the talent you need as your business grows. The centre is located on a new mixed development and includes offices of all sizes, meeting rooms, co-working space, and top-quality business Wi-Fi. It’s easy to get to two airports – Heathrow and Gatwick – from here.

displayAddress: 2 Guildford Business Park, Guildford, GU2 8XG
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Guildford Description This contemporary, tree-lined business park in a semi-rural location provides entrepreneurs and creatives with the best of both worlds. Home to blue-chip brands including Philips, Enstar and Colgate Palmolive, with a schedule of activities and events for tenants, it’s the perfect flexible working hub. Building 2 boasts an impressive double-height reception area that’s sure to impress clients and colleagues alike. Across a well-appointed suite of private offices, elegant meeting rooms and comfortable co-working areas, you’ll find high-speed Wi-Fi, friendly staff and natural light in abundance. Location Located just off the A3, a mere 20 minutes from Guildford’s charming and amenity-rich high street, this business centre is incredibly well connected. A short walk will get you to Austin Pearce and Woodbridge Meadows Bus Stops, while Guildford Train Station is a mere 1.5 miles away. A courtesy shuttle bus also connects the centre to the station every 15 minutes. Surrey is an area known for its natural beauty, and Guilford is no exception. The town’s historic high street features a wide range of bars, restaurants and top retail brands, while cultural attractions such as the cathedral, museum, castle, and Stoke Park Gardens provide fantastic opportunity for inspiration.

displayAddress: Centaur House, Ancells Road, Fleet, GU51 2UJ
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Fleet Description The Ancells Business Park Centre is located in a two-storey office complex prominently situated at the front of this landscaped park. Fleet offers a superb commercial location in Hampshire on the popular M3 corridor with exceptional transport links. Although it has traditionally been a dormitory town housing commuters to London, Fleet now has several business parks and a variety of high profile companies are based here. Hampshire has a diverse and vibrant economy catering for companies of all sizes that remains competitive compared to that of the south-east and UK. Most people are employed in service-type activities, with distribution, hotels and restaurants, transport and communications, finance, IT, public administration and education and health topping the list. The county also has a growing proportion - well above the national average and the largest in the south-east - of high performance engineering and advanced manufacturing businesses in the aerospace, marine and pharmaceuticals sectors.

displayAddress: 268 Bath Road, Slough, SL1 4DX
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Slough Description The Slough Bath Road Centre is located in a striking glass building designed by architect Sir Norman Foster. It is strategically situated on the Slough Trading Estate, which is occupied by several blue chip companies as well as smaller start-ups, and is close to the Mars factory ' Slough's most famous business resident. The building is one of the largest fully-serviced business centres in Europe, capable of catering for both small and large-scale office needs. In this vibrant, highly successful business community, neighbouring companies are involved in a variety of fields including IT, telecommunications, food manufacturing, health and research and development. Situated over three floors, the modern and sleek offices boast wall to wall windows giving them a spacious, bright and airy feel. Some offices have a view of Windsor Castle. A lovely atrium cafe used by clients and visitors is available on site. With excellent road and rail links, the centre has a great location.

displayAddress: The Porter Building, 1 Brunel Way, Slough, SL1 1FQ
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Slough Description An inspiring office space in a prime location, The Porter Building could be the stylish step-up your business requires. Incredibly easy to reach, this office is just a minute’s walk away from Slough’s train and bus stations; a 20-minute drive from Heathrow; and a 35-minute train journey from London. Five floors of open-plan reception areas, office space, meeting rooms and conference suites enclose a beautiful ‘green-heart’ atrium, which fills the whole building with natural light. A rooftop terrace provides a sublime break area – and can be rented (complete with bar) to entertain in the evening. This eco-conscious business centre also has underground car parking with electric-car charging points, and bicycle parking spaces.

displayAddress: 59-60 Windsor Thames Street, Windsor, SL4 1TX
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Windsor Description This centre is positioned in a recently redeveloped Georgian residence which has been sympathetically converted and retains a sense of warmth and history. Some of the offices have balconies overlooking a picturesque section of the river Thames and Eton Bridge and there are fantastic views of Windsor and the castle from the other side of the building. A central atrium fills the communal area with plenty of light and gives a relaxed open feel to the ground floor. The business lounge situated at the front of the building benefits from a full floor-to-ceiling window and fantastic views of the town centre. The centre is located just a few steps from the entrance a pedestrian bridge over the river giving access to Eton and its many amenities. Windsor is in the Thames Valley, one of the wealthiest regions in the European Union, often referred to as the 'engine room of the UK economy'.

displayAddress: Rourke House, 3 Watermans Business Park, Staines-upon-Thames, TW18 3BA
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Staines-upon-Thames Description Situated close to the River Thames, this contemporary business centre in Staines-upon-Thames offers creative and flexible workspace of all kinds with terrific connections by road, rail and air. It’s set in a small business park occupied by a variety of businesses, with access to London Heathrow in 15 minutes. It’s located a short drive from the M25 and M4 motorways and five minutes from Staines and Egham railway stations. Although lying west of London, this modern workspace with business-quality Wi-Fi, is also in a great position to make the most of doing business with the high-tech corporations and pharmaceuticals in fast-growing Reading and Slough, and other towns along the thriving Thames Valley.

displayAddress: Centurion House, London Road, Staines-upon-Thames, TW18 4AX
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Staines-upon-Thames Description Staines' former bus depot is the home of the Staines business centre. The grade-A building is at a prominent location in the town, which is part of the Thames Valley – a desirable business location for international companies. The historic Thameside Surrey town, which is now officially called Staines-Upon-Thames, is popular because it is close to transport links such as the M3 and M25 motorways, Heathrow Airport four miles away and Gatwick Airport nearly 40 miles away. A train from the railway station, which is an easy seven-minute walk from the centre, can reach London in around 40 minutes. Tenants in the building include a nursing and care agency and a software company, reflecting the business services sector firms in this area. Car parking is available on-site.

displayAddress: The Charter Building, Charter Place, Uxbridge, UB8 1JG
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Uxbridge Description Located directly off Uxbridge High Street, Charter Building provides a spectacular entrance into a series of professional workspaces. Whether you are looking for co-working space, a quiet office or meeting rooms, you’ll find it here alongside a built-in coffee shop and restaurants. This is first-class, flexible accommodation for growing businesses and those needing extra space – just book online to suit your changing needs. The location and access are good, by road and the nearby tube station. On the outskirts of London and close to Heathrow airport, Uxbridge offers good connections and the building itself is in the heart of this thriving business district.

displayAddress: Highbridge, Oxford Road, Uxbridge, UB8 1HR
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Uxbridge Description The Uxbridge Oxford Road Centre enjoys a waterside business park location. The business park, which offers a relaxing and picturesque environment, is the premier location for businesses in the area. It's home to several blue chip companies and smaller businesses. The centre is close to Uxbridge railway station and the London Underground is a short walk away. Close to the town centre and its amenities.

displayAddress: 6-9 The Square, Stockley Park, Uxbridge, UB11 1FW
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Uxbridge Description These light-filled offices in a contemporary setting are located at The Square, Stockley Park, just west of central London - ideal for working with the international firms on the business park. A spacious reception leads to four floors of offices - fully serviced, leaving you to concentrate on business.

displayAddress: 450 Bath Road, Heathrow, UB7 0EB
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Heathrow Description These modern serviced offices provide a quiet and well-located workspace close to Heathrow Terminal 5. The Regus Heathrow, Bath Road workspace is perfect for airport-related business as well as professionals wanting a well-equipped office. There is a drop-in business lounge and high-speed internet offers fast connectivity. There are 3 private, light-filled meeting rooms in this sophisticatedly designed office space. Location Heathrow Airport offers a large selection of retail, café and restaurant choices. These offices offer secure onsite parking and it is easily reached from junction 14 of the M25 or from junction 4b of the M4. Train services between Heathrow and London include the Heathrow Express which takes 15 minutes. There is also the Heathrow Connect, a stopping service to and from London Paddington. Bus services link Heathrow with the national rail network at Feltham, Reading, Woking and Watford junction.

displayAddress: 200 Brook Drive, Reading, RG2 6UB
detailedDescription: The building boasts a full-height atrium and large open-plan reception area offering meeting rooms, offices, co-working & kitchen facilities Description The Green Park Centre is one of a group of individually designed landmark buildings attractively positioned around Longwater Lake just outside Reading. The building boasts a full-height atrium and large open-plan reception as well as green features such as the Ecotricity turbine, which generates clean energy. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, hot desks, meeting rooms, business grade Internet and a staffed reception. There is also admin support with mail handling and call answering included and a communal kitchen with tea and coffee making facilities. Next to the park is the Madejski Stadium, home of Reading Football Club, the London Irish Rugby Club, a conference centre and the Millennium Hotel.

displayAddress: 400 Thames Valley Park Drive, Reading, RG6 1PT
detailedDescription: The building sits in a 200-acre business park and nature reserve and offers a staffed reception, offices, co-working, meeting rooms Description This attractive and sought-after location is home to many well-known information technology companies. The business centre is in a prestigious, modern 200-acre business park and nature reserve, idyllically positioned close to the south bank of the River Thames on the east side of Reading. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, hot desks, meeting rooms, business grade Internet and a staffed reception. There is also admin support with mail handling and call answering included and a communal kitchen with tea and coffee making facilities. It is close to junction 10 of the M4 and there is a free shuttle bus service to Reading’s business centre and station, both of which can also be reached by a peaceful fifteen-minute walk along the river.

displayAddress: Abbey House, 1650 Arlington Business Park, Reading, RG7 4SA
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Reading Description Perched on the edges of a picturesque lake, the Reading Arlington Business Park centre is set in a stunning location with plentiful parking. The attractively landscaped business park can be seen from the M4 Reading approach and is a short distance from junction 12 at Theale. The positive external impact is amplified by the inside of the building, which is accessed through a bright full-height atrium. The Thames Valley is well known for its hi-tech businesses and the park has its fair share, but it has also attracted well-known companies in finance, confectionery and security. A diverse number of smaller business units are also situated nearby. The motorway offers great connectivity not just to Reading and London but also Swindon, Bristol and the southwest. Heathrow Airport is just 30 minutes away. Theale railway station is a short walk from the park, offering a direct line to London Paddington.

displayAddress: Building 220, Winnersh Triangle, Wokingham, RG41 5TP
detailedDescription: This Grade A building is surrounded by greenery and features an impressive central terrace and lightwell. Description Located in Rainbow, Winnersh, this Grade A building is surrounded by greenery and features an impressive central terrace and lightwell. Whether you want to rent coworking space to work alongside likeminded professionals, or you’re in need of training, conference or meeting rooms that will impress your clients, Winnersh Triangle offers every type of space you may need – all set up and ready to use with admin support to hand Winnersh Triangle typifies the flexible workspace revolution. A stunning three-storey office building with glazed elevations, it features modern, spacious serviced coworking spaces. Each one is complete with superfast, unlimited Wi-Fi, and many more services and amenities to maximise your business’s productivity and success.

displayAddress: Venture House, 2 Arlington Square, Bracknell, RG12 1WA
detailedDescription: The building boasts a grand atrium and on offer are offices, reception, co-working space, meeting rooms and admin support Description The Arlington Square Centre is in a twenty-two acre urban business park in an attractive landscaped location with a lake and fountain, close to Bracknell town centre. A grand atrium spans the front of the building providing a relaxed and open communal area. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, meeting rooms, business grade Internet, a fully staffed reception as well as admin support. Access is excellent, both to the motorway network and public transport and Bracknell is just one hour from London.

displayAddress: Siena Court, Broadway, Maidenhead, SL6 1NJ
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Maidenhead Description The business centre is located at the start of the M4 corridor and has a staffed reception, offices, co-working, meeting rooms, kitchen and admin support, just an easy walk from Maidenhead station. The business centre is home to corporate headquarters and provides a commercial address at the start of the M4 corridor – a large area west of London noted for its high-tech and pharmaceutical sectors. On offer are furnished offices, co-working space, hot desks, meeting rooms, business grade Internet and a staffed reception. There is also admin support with mail handling and call answering included and a communal kitchen with tea and coffee making facilities. The building is an easy walk from the railway station and is accessible by road, with the M4 motorway conveniently close by. Heathrow Airport is also only twenty miles from Maidenhead.

displayAddress: 9 Greyfriars Road, Reading, RG1 1NU
detailedDescription: Office To Let, Reading Description Located in the Thames Valley, the growth town of Reading is abuzz with hi-tech world leaders like Oracle and Microsoft. But it's equally popular with start-ups eager to take advantage of its proximity to London and its outstanding rail, road and air connections. The Greyfriars business centre includes new workspaces two minutes from the revamped railway station and in a great position, within reach of the M4 motorway and all the amenities of the town centre.

displayAddress: Work.Life, Kings Road, Reading, RG1 3BU
detailedDescription: Reading town centre's first co-working space. Location Situated in the epicentre of the Thames Valley’s business scene, this space is just moments from Reading station and the city centres growing number of restaurants, bars and shops. The space benefits from floor to ceiling windows, a panoramic roof terrace, showers, parking and bike racks. Perfect for startups, freelancers and bigger businesses Work.Life Reading is a breath of fresh air into the growing Reading tech and business community.

displayAddress: Concorde Park, Concorde Road, Maidenhead, SL6 4FJ
detailedDescription: Description Recently refurbished Concorde Park offers some of Maidenhead’s finest flexible workspace. Impressing from the moment you walk through the doors, this contemporary business centre boasts a double-height reception sure to leave a lasting impression on colleagues and clients alike. Housing a suite of well-appointed private offices, elegant meeting rooms and spacious co-working areas, you’re guaranteed to find the perfect environment for your business to thrive. And thanks to unlimited high-speed wi-fi and friendly support staff, your productivity will never wane. This business park is supremely well connected, with Norreys Drive and Foresters bus stops a short distance away, and on-site parking for ultimate commuter convenience. Affording all the benefits of an out-of-town location, while standing immediately adjacent to the A404, which links the M40 and M4 motorways, it’s the best of both worlds.

displayAddress: Davidson House, The Forbury, Reading, RG1 3EU
detailedDescription: Description The Forbury Square business centre is in a prominent central location in the hub of Reading's recently redeveloped dynamic business district, close to the high street and main railway station. The building enjoys views over the award-winning Forbury Gardens. An oasis of peace in the centre of town, this delightful walled Victorian garden backs onto the ruins of Reading Abbey and lovely riverside walks. Reading is at the heart of the south east economy and, according to the Centre for Cities, is one of the five most recession-resilient 'cities' in the UK. It has also won accolades as 'best European city for infrastructure'.

displayAddress: West Forest Gate, Finchampstead Road, Wokingham, RG40 2AT
detailedDescription: A modern office building prominently situated in the town centre of Wokingham Key Points Last Suite - 3,742 sqft Impressive double-height reception area Two ten person passenger lifts Male & female toilets on each floor Air conditioning Full access raised floor Car parking space at 1:187 sq ft High quality finishes 5 minutes' walk from the rail station Description West Forest Gate is a modern office building prominently situated in the town centre about 5 minutes’ walk of the rail station. The accommodation is impressive upon arrival, with its double height reception area and high quality finishes. A central lobby overlooks the atrium which in turn provides access to the office suites and the bathrooms, on each floor. The first floor west wing has recently been refurbished to provide an open plan, modern working environment which has excellent natural light and has been newly carpeted throughout.

displayAddress: Units 1-4 The Quad, Arkwright Road, Reading, RG2 0LU
detailedDescription: Flexible Modern office Space with good access to A33 linking to M4 and excellent parking ratio of 1:258 sq ft. Key Points Electric roller shutter loading doors Carpets Fitted kitchens Excellent natural light Passenger lifts Excellent car parking Comfort cooling Description The Quad comprises four adjoining buildings in a courtyard development. There are two 3 storey and two 2 storey buildings each with excellent parking provision. The buildings provide fully fitted air-conditioned refurbished offices to the upper floors, with the ground floors being suitable for a variety of uses including offices, R&D, assembly or storage. Each has the benefit of full height shuttered loading doors. The accommodation is totally flexible, enabling buildings to be linked internally on a floor by floor basis, with the ability to offer a wide range of space options to an occupier.

displayAddress: Hive 3, Arlington Business Park, Reading, RG7 4SA
detailedDescription: Modern and high spec office premises providing floor space of between 14,500 and 58,117 sqft. Description A newly refurbished two storey lakeside office building delivering modern, efficient and contemporary office accommodation.The Hive is strategically located at Junction 12 of the M4 with direct routes to Reading, London and Bristol. Theale Railway station is a few minutes walk from The Hive and provides direct access to London Paddington and Heathrow airport.The building has now compelted and is ready for inspection. Video

displayAddress: Hive 2, Arlington Business Park, Reading, RG7 4SA
detailedDescription: Modern and high spec office building with only 7,355 sq ft remaining on the ground floor. Description A newly refurbished two storey lakeside office building delivering modern, efficient and contemporary office accommodation.The Hive is strategically located at Junction 12 of the M4 with direct routes to Reading, London and Bristol. Plans are being drawn up to refurbish the offices. The building is prominently positioned on the A322 Bagshot Road, 3 miles south of the town centre and train station station. L'Avenir is also excellently situated for connections to both the M4 (Junction 10: 4 miles) and M3 (Junction 3: 6 miles) as well as being within 24 miles of Heathrow Airport.

displayAddress: 130-132 Queens Road, Reading, RG1 4DG, Reading, RG1 4DG
detailedDescription: Very prominent and self contained Town Centre Offices with on site car parking. Within a walk of the main rail station and retail Key Points Passenger Lift 3-4 on site car spaces M&F toilets and disabled facilities Tea point Perimiter trunking for cabling Excellent signage rights Description Modern 4 storey town centre offices contained within an attractive period style facade situated at a very promient road intersection within Reading Town Centre. The accommodation is to be fully refurbished on all floors by the new owner to provide up to date office space. The building is situated on the edge of the conservation area with its attractive period housing and local pubs nearby. Reading is a world class business destination and has a thriving economy with leading companies in Finance, IT, Telecoms and professional services based here. The newly modelled train station which is a walk from the premises, is one of the busiest transport hubs in the UK and has a frequent non stop rail service to London Paddington taking 25 minutes along with services to over 300 oher UK destinations. When crossrail arrives in 2019 it will be possibly to get to Bond Street in Londons West End in 30 minutes. A direct link to Heathrow is also planned.

displayAddress: 64 Clarendon Road, Watford, WD17 1DA

Both the High Street and Intu shopping centre are within walking distance and provide a wide variety of shops and local amenities. Watford is 20 miles north of London and at the centre of Hertfordshire’s business network. The town is the hub of an excellent communications’ network which provides the high standards of road, rail and air transport that are so essential to successful modern companies. The area provides an excellent standard of living with first class schools and hospitals, a wide choice of shopping, leisure and recreation facilities, golf courses, theatres and cinemas.

The available office accommodation in 400 Capability Green provides high quality, Grade A office space benefiting from new internal office finishes and excellent natural light. The common parts and WCs have been upgraded and the refurbished reception includes a new reception desk, soft seating and break out areas.
